data.title: Atom won't start on Fedora
data.body:
I think I might have messed something up by installed a locally built RPM package of Atom on top of existing installation, but I'm not sure. Here's what I did:
1. Built Atom from git
2. Built an RPM package by running `script/grunt mkrpm`
3. Installed the package with `rpm -i`, at that time both official package and mine were installed
4. None on the two Atoms wanted to start, so I deleted both via yum
5. Re-installed the official RPM package

After I've done all that Atom still wouldn't start, neither in normal nor in safe mode. When I run Atom from terminal nothing happens - no errors or other messages.

OS: Fedora 21
Atom version: 0.182.0

data.title: Update needed cursors only
data.body:
If one cursor changed, all of them were recomputed in `TextEditorPresenter`. With a small refactoring, we gain quite a lot of speed (noticeable especially on multiline selections when moving left and right).

:racehorse: :racehorse: :racehorse: 

As usual, a second pair of :eyes: is always welcome! Thanks :bow:

data.title: Add selection above/below all the way
data.body:
Keycodes `ctrl-alt-up/down` are linked to `editor:add-selection-above/below`, but is there also an editor command to add the selection above/below on all the lines all the way to the top/bottom? I've tried `ctrl-alt-pgup/pgdn/home/end` and had a look in the command pallette (`ctrl-shift-p`) but haven't found it.

[see also](https://discuss.atom.io/t/add-selection-above-below-all-the-way/14245)

data.title: Ctrl-shift-right at end of line doesnâ€™t select EOL and next line whitespace up to first word
data.body:
I expect that a ctrl-shift-right with the cursor at the end of the line, selects the end-of-line and the white-space at the beginning of the next line, but it doesn't.

[see also](https://discuss.atom.io/t/ctrl-right-at-end-of-line-doesnt-select-eol-and-next-line-whitespace-up-to-first-word/14889)

data.title: Opening and closing Uncaught error stack trace results in duplication
data.body:
When an uncaught exception occurs opening and closing the stack trace results in the "Open stack trace", "Close stack trace" labels being duplicated.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1090602/6348858/dc518e30-bc1b-11e4-867d-d691d3ce3788.PNG)

data.title: [Package Related] JavaScript files do not open new tab
data.body:
I am running Version 0.182.0 of Atom on Mac OS X 10.10, and I have encountered a bug where opening a JavaScript file does not open the file in a new tab, which I would assume is the expected behavior. To the best of my knowledge, only JavaScript files with the .js extension are affected.

![screenshot 2015-02-24 04 46 39 copy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3085408/6346758/92626c30-bbe0-11e4-96d9-e81ea780568a.png)

data.title: Fix a lint warning reported by `./script/grunt lint`.
data.body: Now it runs without reporting any issues.

data.title: Report deprecation warning when 'use 6to5' is used instead of 'use babel'.
data.body:
In Deprecation Cop, the warning is associated with `atom core` rather than the package that loaded the file with the old pragma.

Also, even though the deprecation message is parameterized by `filePath`, multiple deprecation warnings about the 6to5 pragma appear to be coalesced into a single warning under `atom core`.

data.title: Upgrade pathwatcher to ^4.0.1.
data.body:
The main problem with upgrading `pathwatcher` is that the semantics of `exists()` have changed from 3.x to 4.x. Previously, it returned a boolean synchronously. In 4.x, `existsSync()` should be used to return a boolean synchronously and `exists()` will return a `Promise` that resolves to a boolean.

Here are PRs to upgrade known uses of `exists()` in the wild in third-party Atom packages:

https://github.com/leny/atom-tree-ignore/pull/4
https://github.com/vvakame/language-review/pull/9
https://github.com/m1ga/ti-create/pull/2
https://github.com/rackerlabs/atom-cloud-sync/pull/24
https://github.com/radicaled/dart-tools/pull/20

Though from a cursory look through those PRs, I think it might be possible to upgrade safely without breaking those packages because they seem to pull in their own `pathwatcher` dependencies and instantiate `File` from those rather than operate on a `File` that was created by Atom core. Assuming that is the case, then Atom core could use a different version of `File` than those packages.

data.title: Opening a file in an existing window shouldn't add a project path
data.body: Right now, if I run `atom some-directory` then `atom another-directory/some-file.txt`, the directory `another-directory` is added to the project as a new root directory. This is wrong.

data.title: Fix container typo in upgrading-your-ui-theme.md
data.body: Fixed misspelling of container in selector table.

data.title: Open-Apple F should allow you to search packages list when viewing installed packages
data.body:
I went to the packages list, looking to change a particular packages setting, and expected Command-F to allow me to search the list (thinking it was just an Atom view). Turns out that's not the case (I had to click into the search filter box, despite the native search dialog popping up).

It'd be awesome if either native search worked, or hitting Command-F hijacked the native functionality and dropped me in the filter dialog when listing installed plugins.

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of undefined
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Select the last line of document
2. hit backspace to delete it
3. Do it again even though there is nothing else to delete on the line

**Atom Version**: 0.181.0
**System**: linux 3.13.0-45-generic
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of undefined

```
At /opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/history.js:124

TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of undefined
    at TextEditorPresenter.module.exports.TextEditorPresenter.updateLinesState (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/text-editor-presenter.js:246:37)
    at /opt/atom/resources/app/src/text-editor-presenter.js:86:17
    at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:82:11)
    at /opt/atom/resources/app/src/text-editor.js:210:32
    at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:82:11)
    at DisplayBuffer.module.exports.DisplayBuffer.emitDidChange (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/display-buffer.js:318:20)
    at DisplayBuffer.module.exports.DisplayBuffer.handleBufferMarkersUpdated (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/display-buffer.js:1586:21)
    at /opt/atom/resources/app/src/display-buffer.js:5:61
    at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:82:11)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.applyPatch (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:599:20)
```
### Commands

```
  2x -0:01.0 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {},
  "editor": {
    "invisibles": {},
    "fontSize": 15
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
No installed packages

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: fix #5602
data.body: Issue #5602 is that packages that are `apm link --dev`ed are undefined and unusable in a normal `atom` session. While reading through the `PackageManager` source today, I noticed that the path `~/.atom/dev/packages` is only added to the package search path when in `devMode`. This tiny fix should resolve that issue.

data.title: nextAction called even in case of error
data.body:
This contradicts the comment:

```
# * `nextAction` (optional) {Function} which will be called after the item is
#   successfully saved.
```

The call should probably be in the `else` clause of the `try` block, if CS supported that.

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/dcbff35ef5dce9b69fdb7f6dd485dbdd6d22d6fe/src/pane.coffee#L488
https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/dcbff35ef5dce9b69fdb7f6dd485dbdd6d22d6fe/src/pane.coffee#L508

data.title: Restart and Update Doesn't from Release Notes Page
data.body:
Using the Restart and Update button on the release notes view doesn't properly restart and update. Atom closes, but it never restarts. When launched again, it hasn't updated. Restart and update from the Atom Menu works fine.

2010 iMac, OSX 10.10.2

data.title: language-lua should be installed by default
data.body:
Many other programming languages are supported out-of-the-box, but not Lua.
This led me to think for a moment that there is no syntax highlighting in Atom.

Please include language-lua package in core in future versions.
Thanks in advance.

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getScopeDescriptor' of undefined
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Save a HTML file

I had 3 open panes at the time. (top left, bottom left, single right)

it looks like it only happens when I save a HTML (only HTML) file in bottom left pane (only in this pane).

After the error happens in described pane, moving the file to other panes will cause the same error.

data.title: Backslash (\) and At (@) characters do not work in editor
data.body:
When using the Editor on Windows 8.1, I'm not able to write backslashes and at-signs. Every other application works just fine.
I'm using a german (QUERTZ) keyboard, so the key combinations are `Alt Gr + Q` for `@` and `Alt Gr + ÃŸ` for `\`. Interestingly I am still able to write them with the Alt + Numpad combinations (`Alt + 6 + 4` for `@` and `Alt + 9 + 2` for `\`).

data.title: Cursor blinking distracting in the inspector
data.body:
When I open the Atom web inspector, the class `blink-off` is constantly being added and removed as the cursor blinks, which often pushes and pulls everything by one line. This makes inspecting very hard, is there a workaround?

![cursor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/471278/6325806/8e9d96aa-bb4b-11e4-90ea-70b0a59bcbf3.gif)

data.title: File tab not working
data.body:
I have an issue/inconsistency with file tabs. Most files doesn't spawn a file tab (with the file name). Instead the tab of the current file stays. However, the content of the file shows.

It seems related to being able to open files with single / double click? Files that for some reason needs double click doesn't get a tab. Single click files works as expected.

Can't detect any pattern for file types. Just have normal files as *.js and *.html etc.

OS X 10.10.2
Atom 0.182.0
